citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Dechloromonas agitata sp. nov.
Dechloromonas agitata (a.gi.ta'ta. L. fem. part. adj. agitata agitated, highly active)
Cells can grow with O2, ClO−3 or ClO−4 as alternative electron acceptors.
Organics used as alternative electron donors include propionate, butyrate, lactate, succinate, yeast extract, fumarate and malate.
The reduced form of the humic substances analogue 2,6-anthrahydroquinone disulfonate, Fe(II) or sulfide can also serve as alternative electron donors coupled to the reduction of chlorate.
Fe(II) is oxidized to insoluble amorphous Fe(III) oxide while sulfide is oxidized to elemental sulfur.
Optimum growth is observed at 35 °C, pH 7.5 and 1% NaCl with acetate (10 mM) as electron donor and chlorate (10 mM) as electron acceptor.
Type strain, CKBT, has been deposited in the American Type Culture Collection under ATCC 700666T and in the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen und Zellkulturen GmbH under DSM 13637T.
